intro: Scabiosa ruthenica, commonly known as the Ruthenian scabious, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features upright, branched stems covered in soft, grayish-green foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its flowers have a distinctive, slightly hairy appearance and are arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences. Scabiosa ruthenica is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
